Jonathan Bayer is a freelance musician, Jewish educator and storyteller in San Francisco.

Regular gigs:

  • Shaliach (prayer leader) for The Kitchen, an independent Jewish community based in San Francisco’s Mission district
  • Music Director for Congregagation Beth Sholom
  • Song leader/ music teacher for Congregation Emanu-El’s Youth and Family Education and Early Childhood Centers
  • Holiday Songleader/ Shaliach for Jewish Community Center Early Childhood Center
  • Shaliach/ storyteller for Torah n Tots at Peninsula Temple Sholom
  • Music teacher/ storyteller for Gan Noe
  • Youth facilitator, Redwood City Study Group
  • Shabbat song leader for JCC Maccabi Sports Camp
  • Musician-in-residence for Camp Ohr Lanu, a camp for families with children with special needs at Camp Ramah, Ojai

He sometimes works for:

  • G-dcast – his favorite is The Mountain and the Cliff, but he did the music for half a dozen
  • Brandies Hillel Day School
  • Yavneh Day School
  • The Contemporary Jewish Museum
  • Kol Shofar
  • Rodef Sholom
  • Oshman JCC in Palo Alto
  • Santa Rosa JCC
  • PJ Library
  • Jewish Community Library
  • Chai Tots Pre-School
  • Peninsula Temple Sinai

Privates:

  • Weddings, Bar Mitzvahs, office parties, campfires– either solo or fronting a band. Contact for references.

More cool stuff:

  • CDs–“Favorites never heard before” and “Fanimals and Amilies”. Available for download on cdbaby.com
  • The Bay Easy Brass Band
  • New York Historical Society– wrote and performed musical, “The Battle for Brooklyn”
  • The Jewish Museum– wrote and performed “Pharaoh’s Bad Day”
  • New York Transit Museum– wrote and performed “Steel Driving Man; stories and songs about everything that rides rails&* rdquo;
  • Pumpkin.com– scored and recorded portions music for learning English software
